publish.description: Takes in a string parameter and says 'Hello' to the parameter! This ALSO emits a separate event, broadcast globally.

subscribe.description: Takes in a string parameter and says 'Hello' to the parameter! This ALSO emits a separate event, broadcast globally.

HelloExample.description:
Rudimentary capability implementation example.

All capability implementations are required to have an @intersect_status decorated function,
but we do not use it here.

The operation we are calling is `say_hello_to_name` , so the message being sent will need to have
an operationId of `say_hello_to_name`. The operation expects a string sent to it in the payload,
and will send a string back in its own payload.

The operation we are calling also emits its own event.

IntersectDataHandler.description:
What data transfer type do you want to use for handling the request/response?

Default: MESSAGE
IntersectDataHandler.title: IntersectDataHandler

userspaceHeaders.description:
Matches the current header definition for INTERSECT messages.

ALL messages should contain this header.

created_at.description: the UTC timestamp of message creation
created_at.title: Created At

sdk_version.description: SemVer string of SDK's version, used to check for compatibility
sdk_version.title: Sdk Version

data_handler.description: Code signifying where data is stored.

has_error.description: If this value is True, the payload will contain the error message (a string)
has_error.title: Has Error
